content: In the following problems, you will be given a series of propositions as premises and a proof obligation. The premises are in the form '(1) xxx. (2) xxx. (3) xxx. ...', and the proof obligation is in the form 'Prove: (n) xxx.' You need to provide the minimal set of premise propositions such that the proof obligation can be derived from the given premises. You should present the result in the form '(1),(2),(3),...->(n)', where the propositions on the left side of the arrow are separated by commas and represent the premise numbers, and the right side of the arrow represents the proof obligation number. Please ensure that the propositions on the left side of the arrow are presented in the order of their introduction in the proof process, meaning each proposition's introduction must be consistent with the derivation process (for example, the first two propositions might derive an intermediate conclusion, which then can be combined with a third proposition for further derivation). The answer should only be in the form '(1),(2),(3),...->(n)'.(For each problem, you need to first present three related but not identical problems, along with a description of each problem and its solution. Finally, provide the answer to the original problem in the form of "Therefore, the final answer is: ".)

Premises: [(1) Every tumpus is transparent. (2) Brimpuses are grimpuses. (3) Every lempus is angry. (4) Dumpuses are tumpuses. (5) Dumpuses are blue. (6) Dumpuses are zumpuses. (7) Grimpuses are vumpuses. (8) Every numpus is small. (9) Grimpuses are wumpuses. (10) Each impus is a yumpus. (11) Grimpuses are not fast. (12) Every impus is loud. (13) Every tumpus is a lempus. (14) Every brimpus is not earthy. (15) Each vumpus is liquid. (16) Every zumpus is dull. (17) Tumpuses are brimpuses. (18) Every brimpus is a numpus. (19) Stella is an impus. (20) Stella is a dumpus.] Prove: (21) Stella is not fast.

Similar problem: 
Premises: [(1) All flimps are bimps. (2) Every climp is a dlimp. (3) Every flimp is a slimp. (4) Bimps are pimps. (5) Dilmps are flimps. (6) Slumps are clumps. (7) Every limp is small. (8) Each pimp is a wimp. (9) Bimps are not fast. (10) Every wimp is loud. (11) Every flimp is a climp. (12) Every slimp is pink. (13) Every dlimp is dirty. (14) Every climp is a pimp. (15) Every limp is a slump. (16) Every bimp is not tall. (17) Every clump is hairy. (18) Every plimp is liquid. (19) Lily is a pimp. (20) Lily is a slimp.] Prove: (21) Lily is not tall.

Another related problem: 
Premises: [(1) All gups are rups. (2) Every hup is a kup. (3) Every cup is a pup. (4) Rups are zups. (5) Kups are gups. (6) Hups are not fast. (7) Every lup is small. (8) Gups are not wups. (9) Every zup is loud. (10) Every pup is a sup. (11) Every rup is a cup. (12) Every kup is a hup. (13) Every pup is a lup. (14) Every zup is dirty. (15) Every sup is liquid. (16) Every gup is not tall. (17) Every hup is hairy. (18) Every kup is pink. (19) Every gup is a tup. (20) Tina is a kup.] Prove: (21) Tina is not fast.

Another related problem: 
Premises: [(1) All lembs are humbs. (2) Every jumb is a kumb. (3) Every lumb is a mumb. (4) Humbs are tumbs. (5) Kumbs are lembs. (6) Jumbs are not fast. (7) Every numb is small. (8) Lembs are not wumbs. (9) Every tumb is loud. (10) Every mumb is a jumb. (11) Every kumb is a lumb. (12) Every numb is a lumb. (13) Every kumb is dirty. (14) Every jumb is pink. (15) Every lumb is liquid. (16) Every kumb is not tall. (17) Every lumb is hairy. (18) Every humb is a jumb. (19) Mary is a lumb. (20) Mary is a kumb.] Prove: (21) Mary is not fast.

Therefore, the final answer is: (19),(20)->(21).

Premises: [(0) Every mother has a son. (1) Every tumpus is transparent. (2) Brimpuses are grimpuses. (3) Every lempus is angry. (4) Dumpuses are tumpuses. (5) Dumpuses are blue. (6) Dumpuses are zumpuses. (7) Grimpuses are vumpuses. (8) Every numpus is small. (9) Grimpuses are wumpuses. (10) Each impus is a yumpus. (11) Grimpuses are not fast. (12) Every impus is loud. (13) Every tumpus is a lempus. (14) Every brimpus is not earthy. (15) Each vumpus is liquid. (16) Every zumpus is dull. (17) Tumpuses are brimpuses. (18) Every brimpus is a numpus. (19) Stella is an impus. (20) Stella is a dumpus.] Prove: (21) Stella is not fast.
